title: The U.S. Shifts Focus to Venezuelan Oil, but Output Is Low
summary: Even if the U.S. lifts sanctions on Venezuela, years of mismanagement and nationalizations have made Venezuelan production just a fraction of what it was in the 1990s. BOGOTA, Colombia-Even as the U.S. considers lifting sanctions so Venezuela gets oil flowing, the reality is that the country's oil sector is ill-prepared to start churning out more crude and lower fast-rising oil prices amid the Ukraine war.

title: Stocks End Sharply Lower as Dow Enters Correction
summary: Stocks drop more than 2%, Nasdaq hits a bear market as oil prices briefly rise to $130 a barrel. The Dow Jones Industrial Average slid nearly 800 points Monday, marking a 10% decline from January's high to close in correction territory for the first time in two years, as surging oil prices heightened concerns about inflation and economic growth.

title: Oil CEOs, Biden Officials Warn Oil Volatility Is Here to Stay
summary: At industry conference in Texas, speakers caution about lack of short-term options to address rising energy prices. HOUSTON-The chief executives of some of the world's largest oil companies and U.S. government officials warned Monday that there were no quick-fix solutions to the higher energy prices and market volatility that have followed Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Uber Raises Quarterly Guidance on Delivery Growth, Ridership Recovery
summary: Chief Executive Dara Khosrowshahi says the company expects the coming travel season to be one of the strongest ever. Uber Technologies Inc. raised its first-quarter guidance Monday, saying its ride-hailing business is bouncing back quickly from the disruption caused by the spread of the Omicron variant around the end of 2021.

title: The Surge in Gasoline Prices Isn't Slowing Down
summary: Traders and shippers are shunning Russian oil, pulling millions of barrels from global supplies and powering new increases at the pump. Prices at the gas pump are soaring to near record levels across the U.S., threatening to further pressure consumers and an economy already struggling with sky-high inflation.

title: Bed Bath & Beyond Soars After Chewy Co-Founder Takes Stake
summary: The billionaire investor made a similar investment in GameStop before a meme-stock frenzy. Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond Inc. skyrocketed after Ryan Cohen, the billionaire co-founder of pet-supplies retailer Chewy Inc . , disclosed a 9.8% stake through his investment firm in the housewares retailer.

title: U.S. Treasurys Regain Favor
summary: The yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury note has dropped to around 1.75% from 2.044% in mid-February. Russia's invasion of Ukraine and hints of slowing wage growth have driven money back into U.S. government bonds in recent days, dragging down longer-term interest rates and providing some relief to investors buffeted by declines in riskier assets.

title: Administration Pushes Unions, Underrepresented Workers for Infrastructure Projects
summary: Agency guidelines would favor grant applications that make it easier for workers to join unions. The Biden administration is planning to give preference to infrastructure projects that encourage workers to unionize or that hire from underrepresented groups as it prepares to spend billions of dollars from last year's infrastructure law, administration officials said.

title: Oil Industry Contemplates World Without Russian Crude
summary: Crude traders brace for disruption if Western countries ban imports of Russian oil. As oil prices shoot to levels unseen since before the 2008 financial crisis, the energy industry is asking a previously unthinkable question: How would it cope if it has to forgo Russian oil?

title: What Companies Have Pulled Back From Russia?
summary: Western businesses such as Apple, Boeing and Volkswagen are re-evaluating operations in Russia after its invasion of Ukraine. Russia's invasion of Ukraine has prompted many Western companies across industries to re-evaluate their businesses in Russia. Some have decided to suspend operations in the country, while others have decided to pull out entirely.

title: How Much Oil Does the U.S. Import From Russia?
summary: Despite being the top global producer, the U.S. turns to Russian crude to service more-isolated coastal markets and keep refineries running at optimal levels. The fracking boom made America the world's biggest oil producer a few years ago, but the U.S. still imports millions of barrels each day from other parts of the world, including Russia.

title: AI Will Evaluate Your Job Application. Do You Still Want to Apply?
summary: A study suggests that the answer may depend on how artificial intelligence is used. If job seekers knew companies were using artificial intelligence to fill open positions, would it stop them from applying for the job?

title: William Ackman Acquires Stake in Canadian Pacific
summary: Investment worth more than $1 billion marks a return to railroad for billionaire. Billionaire investor William Ackman acquired a stake in Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd. as the railroad seeks regulatory approval for its proposed $27 billion merger with Kansas City Southern.

title: Bed Bath & Beyond Goes to the Moon
summary: Shares surged after GameStop chairman disclosed stake in struggling retailer. Diamond hands might be a struggling retailer's best friend.

title: Big Auditors to Leave Russia
summary: All four top accounting firms are cutting ties with their Russian operations. The Big Four accounting firms are cutting ties with their Russian operations, walking away from businesses built up over decades that between them employ more than 15,900 people.

title: Should Amazon, Microsoft, Google and Other Cloud Companies Face More Government Oversight?
summary: Individuals and companies depend on their services. But they are more lightly regulated than other crucial industries. Three experts debate their future.. Cloud-computing services are so ubiquitous that it's hard to fathom modern life without them.

title: Replacing Russian Gas in Europe Will Require State Planning
summary: European Union wants to speed up its green path to energy security, but it is up to individual countries to outline solid plans that cut the risk for investors. The war in Ukraine has ended the notion that natural gas is a reliable transition fuel for Europe, but it will still need to rely on it for years to come.

title: Former Nissan Executive in Ghosn Case Returns to U.S.
summary: Suspended sentence handed down by Tokyo court allows Kelly to return home to Tennessee. TOKYO-Former Nissan Motor Co. executive Greg Kelly flew back to the U.S. from Japan on Monday, ending a Tokyo stay that he thought would take just a few days but ended up lasting more than three years.

title: Oasis, Whiting Reach Deal to Merge
summary: Deal between rival North Dakota shale drillers would form company valued at $6 billion including debt. Rival North Dakota shale drillers Oasis Petroleum Inc. and Whiting Petroleum Corp. said Monday they have reached a deal to merge, forming a combined company that they valued at $6 billion including debt.

title: Facebook Gains Inside Role in U.S. 250th Anniversary Project
summary: Organization torn over Meta deal that some staffers worry will put off other potential corporate sponsors. WASHINGTON-The America250 Foundation, a nonprofit planning the government's observance of the American Revolution's 250th anniversary, has signed a deal with Meta Platforms Inc. giving Facebook 's parent an inside role in producing and promoting the Semiquincentennial commemoration in exchange for $10 million, according to documents viewed by The Wall Street Journal and confirmed by the company.

title: Shipping Stocks Might Sink Not Swim
summary: War in Ukraine has contradictory impacts on shippers and shipping rates. But the biggest story of 2022 will still probably be the tapering off of enormous goods demand.. For global shipping companies that spent the past year feasting on insatiable demand for their services, the party must end sooner or later. The Russia-Ukraine war is putting pressure on the shipping lines with delivery disruptions and rerouting of cargo. But the big story remains the normalization of U.S. demand as stimulus fades and the waning Omicron wave pushes global consumption back toward services, which appears to already be weighing on some shipping rates.

title: Russian Aluminum Giant's Owner Considers Splitting Foreign Operations
summary: EN+ reviews Rusal strategy in wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The controlling shareholder of Rusal , Russia's largest aluminum producer, said it was exploring a separation of the company's international operations and that its British chairman was stepping down.

title: Boeing's Big Bet on Russian Titanium Includes Ties to Sanctioned Oligarch
summary: Plane maker has suspended buying the metal from Russia but must still deal with ties with company linked to sanctioned oligarch and Putin ally. Boeing Co. has suspended parts of its business in Russia, but it still has to deal with its relationship to a key titanium supplier led by a sanctioned oligarch who once worked in the KGB with President Vladimir Putin.

title: U.S. Retirement Funds Brace for Losses
summary: A sustained downturn could squeeze state and local government budgets. Volatile stock markets are eroding the retirement savings of America's teachers and firefighters after public pension systems ended last year with equity holdings at a 10-year high.

title: Hong Kong's Hang Seng Hits Five-Year Low
summary: Some indexes in mainland China close at levels last registered in 2020. Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index dropped 3.9% Monday to close at its lowest since July 2016, as an international selloff fueled by the war in Ukraine put fresh pressure on a market already suffering from Beijing's corporate crackdowns and tough local pandemic policies.

title: Tom Cotton to Compare Reagan and Trump in Speech on GOP's Future
summary: Arkansas senator and possible 2024 presidential candidate is the latest in a series of Reagan Library speakers. Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas is expected to argue in a high-profile speech Monday evening that presidents Ronald Reagan and Donald Trump share common roots in the Republican Party and that those who suggest the GOP must pick a path that embraces one or the other are wrong.

title: Russia Recruiting Syrians for Urban Combat in Ukraine, U.S. Officials Say
summary: Moscow is looking for help from foreign fighters to take cities including Kyiv. WASHINGTON-Moscow is recruiting Syrians skilled in urban combat to fight in Ukraine as Russia's invasion is poised to expand deeper into cities, according to U.S. officials.

title: Land & Buildings Nominates Founder Litt to Ventas Board
summary: The real-estate focused investment firm owns roughly $50 million of the healthcare REIT's shares. A shareholder activist is pushing to join the board of Ventas Inc., arguing the healthcare real-estate investment trust would benefit from an investor's perspective.

title: Oil Tops $130 a Barrel as Russian Attacks Escalate
summary: Buyers are bidding up prompt crude deliveries to replace Russian barrels. Oil buyers racing to replace Russia' taboo crude are paying record premiums for barrels that can be delivered now rather than later, reflecting worries about adequate near-term fuel supplies and expectations that high prices will reduce consumption and encourage drilling.

title: Chewy Co-Founder Ryan Cohen Takes Large Stake in Bed Bath & Beyond
summary: Billionaire investor wants the chain to simplify its turnaround plan and consider a sale or separation of Buybuy Baby. Ryan Cohen, the billionaire co-founder of online pet-products retailer Chewy Inc., has a big stake in Bed Bath & Beyond Inc. and is pushing the housewares retailer to streamline its strategy and explore strategic alternatives.
